00016 // !!! NOTE: THE CURRENT INTER-/INTRA-PROCEDURAL ANALYSIS API EFFECTIVELY ASSUMES THAT EACH ANALYSIS WILL BE EXECUTED
00017 // !!!       ONCE BECAUSE DURING A GIVEN ANALYSIS PASS THE INTRA- ANALYSIS MAY ACCUMULATE STATE AND THERE IS NO
00018 // !!!       API FUNCTION THAT THE INTER- ANALYSIS CAN USE THE RE-INITIALIZE THE STATE OF THE INTRA- ANALYSIS.
00019 
00020 /*************************
00021  *** Dataflow Analyses ***
00022  *************************/
00023 class InterProceduralDataflow;
00024 
00025 class IntraProceduralDataflow : virtual public IntraProceduralAnalysis
00026 {
00027         public:
00028         // generates the initial lattice state for the given dataflow node, in the given function, with the given NodeState
00029         //virtual std::vector<Lattice*> genInitState(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state)=0;
00030 
00031         // !!! NOTE: THIS FUNCTION SHOULD BE AMENDED TO MAKE IT POSSIBLE TO SPECIFY THAT WE WANT THE INITIAL STATE
00032         // !!!       FOR ABOVE THIS NODE, BELOW THIS NODE OR A UNION OF BOTH. THIS IS IMPORTANT FOR LATTICES THAT
00033         // !!!       MAINTAIN DIFFERENT INFORMATION FOR THE DIFFERENT CASES, SUCH AS VarsExprsProductLattice, WHERE
00034         // !!!       DIFFERENT VARIABLES ARE LIVE BEFORE AND AFTER THE NODE. IN PARTICULAR, THIS WOULD BE USEFUL FOR
00035         // !!!       INTERPROCEDURAL ANALYSES WHERE THE SAME SgFunctionDefinition SgNode IS BOTH THE FIRST AND LAST
00036         // !!!       VirtualCFG NODE OF EACH FUNCTION WITH DIFFERENT INDEXES AND THE STATE BELOW IT CORRESPONDS TO THE
00037         // !!!       START OF THE FUNCTION AND THE STATE ABOVE IT CORRESPONDS TO THE END.
00038         virtual void genInitState(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state,
00039                                   std::vector<Lattice*>& initLattices, std::vector<NodeFact*>& initFacts)=0;
00040 
00041 
00042         // Set of functions that have already been visited by this analysis, used
00043         // to make sure that the dataflow state of previously-visited functions is
00044         // not re-initialized when they are visited again.
00045         std::set<Function> visited;
00046 
00047         void setInterAnalysis(InterProceduralDataflow* interDataflowAnalysis)
00048         { this->interAnalysis = (InterProceduralAnalysis*)interDataflowAnalysis; }
00049 
00050         void setInterAnalysis(IntraProceduralDataflow* intraDFAnalysis)
00051         { this->interAnalysis = intraDFAnalysis->interAnalysis; }
00052 
00053         // Dataflow version of the function that intra-procedural analysis on the given function.
00054         // Takes in:
00055         //    state - the function's NodeState
00056         //    analyzeDueToCallers - true if this function is analyzed due to changes in the the dataflow state from
00057         //       its caller functions at their call sites to this function
00058         //    calleesUpdated - true if the function is analyzed due to changes of dataflow state of functions called
00059         //       by this function at their exit points (i.e. points where this state affects the caller)
00060         // Returns true if the function's NodeState gets modified as a result and false otherwise
00061         virtual bool runAnalysis(const Function& func, NodeState* state, bool analyzeDueToCallers, std::set<Function> calleesUpdated)=0;
00062 
00063         // Calls the full dataflow runAnalysis with dummy arguments to make it possible to use IntraProceduralDataflow
00064         // as if it were an IntraProceduralAnalysis
00065         bool runAnalysis(const Function& func, NodeState* state)
00066         {
00067                 // Each function is analyzed as if it were called directly by the language's runtime, ignoring
00068                 // the application's actual call graph
00069                 bool analyzeDueToCallers = true;
00070 
00071                 // We ignore the application's call graph, so it doesn't matter whether this function calls other functions
00072                 std::set<Function> calleesUpdated;
00073 
00074                 return runAnalysis(func, state, analyzeDueToCallers, calleesUpdated);
00075         }
00076 
00077         InterProceduralDataflow* getInterAnalysis() const
00078         {
00079                 return (InterProceduralDataflow*)interAnalysis;
00080         }
00081 };

00085 {

00094

00096     : func(f), dfNode(n), nodeState(s), dfInfo(d)
00097   { }
00098 
00099   virtual bool finish() = 0;

00103 class IntraUnitDataflow : virtual public IntraProceduralDataflow
00104 {
00105         public:
00106 
00107         // the transfer function that is applied to every node
00108         // n - the dataflow node that is being processed
00109         // state - the NodeState object that describes the state of the node, as established by earlier
00110         //         analysis passes
00111         // dfInfo - the Lattices that this transfer function operates on. The function takes these lattices
00112         //          as input and overwrites them with the result of the transfer.
00113         // Returns true if any of the input lattices changed as a result of the transfer function and
00114         //    false otherwise.
00115         virtual bool transfer(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state, const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo)=0;
00116 
00117   class DefaultTransfer : public IntraDFTransferVisitor
00118   {
00119     bool modified;
00120     IntraUnitDataflow *analysis;
00121   public:
00122     DefaultTransfer(const Function& func_, const DataflowNode& n_, NodeState& state_, const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo_, IntraUnitDataflow *a)
00123       : IntraDFTransferVisitor(func_, n_, state_, dfInfo_), modified(false), analysis(a)
00124       { }
00125 
00126 
00127     void visit(SgNode *n) { modified = analysis->transfer(func, dfNode, nodeState, dfInfo); }
00128     bool finish() { return modified; }
00129   };
00130 
00131 
00132     // \todo \pp IMO. the function getTransferVisitor is not necessary and can be removed.
00133     //           Users wanting to write the analysis based on visitors can do so
00134     //           in the transfer function. (This safes one memory allocation, deallocation,
00135     //           and boost::shared_pointer management overhead per transfer).
00136     //           A transfer function using the visitor would look like (if desired this can be
00137     //           simplified by providing a convenience function taking a visitor as argument):
00138     // \code
00139     //           virtual bool transfer(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state, const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo, std::vector<Lattice*>** retState, bool fw)
00140     //           {
00141     //             MyTransferVisitor visitor(myarguments, func, n, ...);
00142     //             n.getNode().accept(visitor);
00143     //             return visitor.finish();
00144     //           }
00145     // \endcode
00146     virtual boost::shared_ptr<IntraDFTransferVisitor> getTransferVisitor(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n,
00147                                                                   NodeState& state, const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo)
00148   { return boost::shared_ptr<IntraDFTransferVisitor>(new DefaultTransfer(func, n, state, dfInfo, this)); }
00149 };

00153         public:
00154         InterProceduralDataflow(IntraProceduralDataflow* intraDataflowAnalysis);
00155 
00156         // the transfer function that is applied to SgFunctionCallExp nodes to perform the appropriate state transfers
00157         // fw - =true if this is a forward analysis and =false if this is a backward analysis
00158         // n - the dataflow node that is being processed
00159         // state - the NodeState object that describes the dataflow state immediately before (if fw=true) or immediately after
00160         //         (if fw=false) the SgFunctionCallExp node, as established by earlier analysis passes
00161         // dfInfo - the Lattices that this transfer function operates on. The function propagates them
00162         //          to the calling function and overwrites them with the dataflow result of calling this function.
00163         // retState - Pointer reference to a Lattice* vector that will be assigned to point to the lattices of
00164         //          the function call's return value. The callee may not modify these lattices.
00165         // Returns true if any of the input lattices changed as a result of the transfer function and
00166         //    false otherwise.
00167         virtual bool transfer(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state,
00168                               const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo, std::vector<Lattice*>** retState, bool fw)=0;

00215

00347 /**********************************************************************
00348  ***                 UnstructuredPassInterDataflow                  ***
00349  *** The trivial inter-procedural dataflow where a intra-procedural ***
00350  *** dataflow analysis is executed once on every function in the    ***
00351  *** application, with no guarantees about how dataflow information ***
00352  *** is transmitted across function calls.                          ***
00353  **********************************************************************/
00354 class UnstructuredPassInterDataflow : virtual public InterProceduralDataflow
00355 {
00356         public:
00357 
00358         UnstructuredPassInterDataflow(IntraProceduralDataflow* intraDataflowAnalysis)
00359                              : InterProceduralAnalysis((IntraProceduralAnalysis*)intraDataflowAnalysis), InterProceduralDataflow(intraDataflowAnalysis)
00360         {}
00361 
00362         // the transfer function that is applied to SgFunctionCallExp nodes to perform the appropriate state transfers
00363         // fw - =true if this is a forward analysis and =false if this is a backward analysis
00364         // n - the dataflow node that is being processed
00365         // state - the NodeState object that describes the dataflow state immediately before (if fw=true) or immediately after
00366         //         (if fw=false) the SgFunctionCallExp node, as established by earlier analysis passes
00367         // dfInfo - the Lattices that this transfer function operates on. The function propagates them
00368         //          to the calling function and overwrites them with the dataflow result of calling this function.
00369         // retState - Pointer reference to a Lattice* vector that will be assigned to point to the lattices of
00370         //          the function call's return value. The callee may not modify these lattices.
00371         // Returns true if any of the input lattices changed as a result of the transfer function and
00372         //    false otherwise.
00373         bool transfer(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state,
00374                       const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo, std::vector<Lattice*>** retState, bool fw)
00375         {
00376                 return false;
00377         }
00378 
00379         void runAnalysis();
00380 };

00382 // Analysis that merges the dataflow states belonging to the given Analysis at all the return statements in the given function
00383 // and produces a list of merged lattices (same number of lattices as were maintained by the nodes in the function).
00384 // NOTE: The callers of this analysis are responsible for deallocating the lattices stored n mergedLatsRetStmt
00385 //       and mergedLatsRetVal at the end of the analysis pass.
00386 class MergeAllReturnStates : public UnstructuredPassIntraAnalysis
00387 {
00388         // Analysis whose states we'll be merging
00389         Analysis* analysis;
00390 
00391         // List of merged lattices of all the return statements and the returned values
00392         std::vector<Lattice*> mergedLatsRetStmt;
00393         std::vector<Lattice*> mergedLatsRetVal;
00394 
00395         public:
00396         //typedef enum ab {above=0, below=1};
00397         protected:
00398         //ab latSide;
00399 
00400         // After the analysis is complete, records true if the state of the mergedLattices changed
00401         // during the analysis and false otherwise
00402         bool modified;
00403 
00404         public:
00405         MergeAllReturnStates(Analysis* analysis/*, ab latSide*/): analysis(analysis)/*, latSide(latSide)*/
00406         { modified=false; }
00407 
00408         MergeAllReturnStates(Analysis* analysis, const std::vector<Lattice*>& mergedLatsRetStmt, const std::vector<Lattice*>& mergedLatsRetVal/*, ab latSide*/):
00409                 analysis(analysis), mergedLatsRetStmt(mergedLatsRetStmt), mergedLatsRetVal(mergedLatsRetVal)/*, latSide(latSide)*/
00410         { modified=false; }
00411 
00412         void visit(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state);
00413 
00414         // Merges the lattices in the given vector into mergedLat, which may be mergedLatsRetStmt or mergedLatsRetVal
00415         // Returns true of mergedLatsStmt changes as a result and false otherwise.
00416         static bool mergeLats(std::vector<Lattice*>& mergedLat, const std::vector<Lattice*>& lats);
00417 
00418         // Returns a reference to mergedLatsRetStmt
00419         std::vector<Lattice*>& getMergedLatsRetStmt() { return mergedLatsRetStmt; }
00420 
00421         // Returns a reference to mergedLatsRetVal
00422         std::vector<Lattice*>& getMergedLatsRetVal() { return mergedLatsRetVal; }
00423 
00424         // Returns the value of modified
00425         bool getModified() { return modified; }
00426 
00427         // Deallocates all the merged lattices
00428         ~MergeAllReturnStates();
00429 };

00431 // A NodeFact associated with a FunctionState that stores the merge of the lattices immediately
00432 // above all return statements in a given function.
00433 class DFStateAtReturns : public NodeFact
00434 {
00435         // The dataflow state at the end of the function, merged over all the return statements
00436         // and the implicit return at the end of the function
00437         std::vector<Lattice*>& latsAtFuncReturn;
00438         // The dataflow state of the return value, merged over all the return statements
00439         std::vector<Lattice*>& latsRetVal;
00440 
00441         public:
00442         //DFStateAtReturns();
00443 
00444         DFStateAtReturns(std::vector<Lattice*>& latsAtFuncReturn, std::vector<Lattice*>& latsRetVal);
00445 
00446         // Returns a copy of this node fact
00447         NodeFact* copy() const;
00448 
00449         // Applies the MergeAllReturnStates analysis on the given function, incorporating the results into
00450         // the lattices held by this object.
00451         // Returns true of the lattices change as a result and false otherwise.
00452         bool mergeReturnStates(const Function& func, FunctionState* fState, IntraProceduralDataflow* intraAnalysis);
00453 
00454         // Returns a reference to latsAtFuncReturn
00455         std::vector<Lattice*>& getLatsAtFuncReturn() { return latsAtFuncReturn; }
00456 
00457         // Returns a reference to latsRetVal
00458         std::vector<Lattice*>& getLatsRetVal() { return latsRetVal; }
00459 
00460         std::string str(std::string indent);
00461 };
00462 
00463 class ContextInsensitiveInterProceduralDataflow : virtual public InterProceduralDataflow, public TraverseCallGraphDataflow
00464 {
00465         // list of functions that still remain to be processed
00466         //list<Function> remaining;
00467 
00468         // The functions that still remain to be processed.
00469 
00470         // These functions need to be processed because they are called by functions that have been processed
00471         // or are called at startup such as main() and the constructors of static objects.
00472         std::set<Function> remainingDueToCallers;
00473 
00474         // Each function F in this map needs to be processed because it has called other functions and those functions
00475         // have now been analyzed and the dataflow information at their exit points has changed since the last time
00476         // F was analyzed. remainingDueToCalls maps each F to all such functions. As such, F needs to be re-analyzed,
00477         // starting at the calls to these functions.
00478         std::map<Function, std::set<Function> > remainingDueToCalls;
00479 
00480         public:
00481         ContextInsensitiveInterProceduralDataflow(IntraProceduralDataflow* intraDataflowAnalysis, SgIncidenceDirectedGraph* graph) ;
00482 
00483         public:
00484 
00485         // the transfer function that is applied to SgFunctionCallExp nodes to perform the appropriate state transfers
00486         // fw - =true if this is a forward analysis and =false if this is a backward analysis
00487         // n - the dataflow node that is being processed
00488         // state - the NodeState object that describes the dataflow state immediately before (if fw=true) or immediately after
00489         //         (if fw=false) the SgFunctionCallExp node, as established by earlier analysis passes
00490         // dfInfo - the Lattices that this transfer function operates on. The function propagates them
00491         //          to the calling function and overwrites them with the dataflow result of calling this function.
00492         // retState - Pointer reference to a Lattice* vector that will be assigned to point to the lattices of
00493         //          the function call's return value. The callee may not modify these lattices.
00494         // Returns true if any of the input lattices changed as a result of the transfer function and
00495         //    false otherwise.
00496         bool transfer(const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, NodeState& state,
00497                       const std::vector<Lattice*>& dfInfo, std::vector<Lattice*>** retState, bool fw);
00498 
00499         // Uses TraverseCallGraphDataflow to traverse the call graph.
00500         void runAnalysis();
00501 
00502         // Runs the intra-procedural analysis every time TraverseCallGraphDataflow passes a function.
00503         void visit(const CGFunction* func);
00504 };
